e4: Adopting the new policy enhances credibility and ethical standards by ensuring accurate financial reporting. Although it may lead to temporary confusion, it ultimately benefits the company by building trust with investors. Long-term, a reputation for transparency and honesty should outweigh short-term adjustments, contributing to a more steadfast and informed investor base. This shift will also mitigate potential legal risks and SEC scrutiny associated with biased reporting practices.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and fairness. Such a policy must be consistent and clear, ensuring disclosures are truthful and fully reflective of the company’s financial health to avoid misleading any stakeholders. It should also consider the broader impact, including potential legal consequences and the effect on less informed investors, ensuring all parties have equal access to the true financial status. Finally, it should comply with regulatory requirements, supporting good governance and fostering trust.
e6: How will the transition to the new policy be communicated to ensure all investors understand the change? What measures will be implemented to monitor and assess the impact of this policy change on investor behavior and company valuation short-term and long-term?
